class.name: GDTerm
class.brief_description: GDTerm is a terminal emulator that supports VT100 and xterm protocols, providing a text-based interface for command-line applications. It features customizable colors, fonts, and scrollback functionality, allowing users to interact with shell commands and applications. It can be used in Godot projects to integrate terminal capabilities directly into games or applications.

method.name: get_num_screen_lines
method.description: Returns the number of lines currently displayed on the terminal screen.

method.name: get_num_scrollback_lines
method.description: Returns the number of lines in the scrollback buffer, which contains previously displayed text.

method.name: get_scroll_pos
method.description: Returns the current scroll position in the terminal.

method.name: get_selected_text
method.description: Returns the currently selected text in the terminal.

method.name: is_active
method.description: Returns whether the terminal is currently active.

method.name: send_input
method.description: Sends input text to the terminal.

method.name: set_scroll_pos
method.description: Sets the scroll position of the terminal.

signal.name: bell_request
signal.description: Emitted when the terminal requests a bell sound.

signal.name: copy_request
signal.description: Emitted when the terminal requests to copy selected text.

signal.name: inactive
